meanings.definition: An artist who creates highly realistic paintings or sculptures that closely resemble photographs.
meanings.sent1: The hyperrealist spent countless hours perfecting the details in their painting of a flower.
meanings.sent2: The art gallery featured a stunning collection of hyperrealist sculptures that amazed visitors.
meanings.sent3: The hyperrealist artist painted a banana so realistically that someone tried to eat it!
meanings.sent4: Her hyperrealist sculptures were so lifelike that they seemed to come alive in the gallery.
meanings.sent5: The hyperrealist's attention to detail was so precise that viewers could mistake their artwork for actual photographs.

meanings.definition: A style of art characterized by extreme realism and attention to detail.
meanings.sent1: The hyperrealist style of painting focuses on capturing every tiny aspect of the subject.
meanings.sent2: Art enthusiasts appreciate the hyperrealist movement for its dedication to realism.
meanings.sent3: In the hyperrealist world, even the most mundane objects become extraordinary masterpieces.
meanings.sent4: The hyperrealist approach to art challenges viewers to question what is real and what is an illusion.
meanings.sent5: The hyperrealist technique brings a new level of depth and intensity to the art world.
